text: this is just a quick update because i
know many of you are eager for an update
after the devastating volcanic eruptions
and tsunami in tonga now we're all safe
and sound aboard curiosity here at great
barrier in new zealand we did not hear
or feel the eruptions but we also had
cyclone cody sitting right next to us so
we already had a lot of wind wave and
current action going on now as for tonga
unfortunately the communications are
still down so whatever the news is
putting out that is the best up-to-date
information that we have and there are
multiple countries that are prepared to
send aid new zealand has already
deployed the air force for aerial
assessments and they sent a navy ship
filled with water and special supplies
the best we can do is wait on those
assessments so we know what they need
and how we can help unfortunately that
could take weeks so we have to sit tight
until we know more because unfortunately
our eagerness to help can sometimes do
more harm than good and i have written
an article about how to make our
donation count and i will link that down
below because even tonga has said it
does not want an influx of aid workers
following the eruption now all that
being said we have received a couple of
text updates from our friends on the
island of ava thanks to a working
satellite communications and they have
been very fortunate there with no
damages or injuries reported they had
minimal ash fall so their air quality is
getting better every day as they've had
easterly winds but of course that is
just one island and they're further away
from the volcano and they're very
concerned about the islands closer to
the volcano which is stuff we don't have
any updates on unfortunately because the
ash clouds have even made satellite
communications there very
difficult so
we are keeping our eyes on the news and
sending
all of our love
to tonga and hoping for the best now if
we learn of something that we can do or
of a way that we can help we will
absolutely make another update
you
